title: Canary Mission correspondence and communications

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records related to the organization Canary Mission. Canary Mission’s website is http://www.canarymission.org.

Please produce:

(1) All communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, between ICE employees and Canary Mission (including any of its officers, employees, or agents). This includes all emails sent to or from a “canarymission.org” email address. 

(2) All internal ICE communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, that include the terms “Canary Mission” or “canarymission.org” or that contain links to any webpages that include the “canarymission.org” domain name.

(3) All communications sent to ICE, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, that include the terms “Canary Mission” or “canarymission.org” or that contain links to any webpages that include the “canarymission.org” domain name. This includes communications submitted via the online ICE Tip Form or the ICE Tip Line phone number.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Francis Lee Maidir

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: W687401-040325
communications.communication:
Dear Police News: 
 
   
  
The City’s AD 1.31 was signed on December 12, 2024. The City informed the Office of the Attorney General of the update on January 9, 2025. The City will implement the changes starting January 21, 2025. 
1. Texas Government Code Section 552.234(c) (the Texas Public Information Act) allows a governmental body to designate one mailing address and one electronic mail address for receiving written requests for public information. The City of San Antonio Administrative Directive 1.31, entitled Open Government, now provides the following methods to requestors seeking records from the City: 
 a. Via email: openrecords@sanantonio.gov 
b. Via the open government portal: https://sanantonio.govqa.us/webapp/_rs/(S(nzhdsq2jtkns5hfojy5kcmbj))/supporthome.aspx 
c. By mail to the City: Open Records Division of the City of San Antonio, P.O. Box 839966, San Antonio, Texas 78283. 
d. By mail to San Antonio Police Department: 315 S. Santa Rosa, San Antonio, Texas 78207. 
e. By mail to San Antonio Fire Department: 315 S. Santa Rosa, San Antonio, Texas 78207. 
f. Note, hand-delivery and in-person requests are permitted under the Act. 
 
2. The City is not required to respond to a written request for public information unless the request is received by one of the methods listed above (Texas Government Code Section 552.205). 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of San Antonio. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 4/3/2025 and given the reference number W687401-040325 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s). You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
In accordance with the Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, the City of San Antonio makes all of its public records available to citizens. 
 
The Public Information Act does not require governmental bodies to create new information, perform legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The City of San Antonio will not comply with a standing request for information to be collected or prepared in the future. 
 
The City of San Antonio will respond within ten business days following submission of requests. The City of San Antonio may collect a fee as prescribed by law for the requested documents. For more information on the Texas Public Information Act, please visit the Texas Attorney General Web site at www.oag.state.tx.us/open/og_faqs.shtml. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center.

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Gila County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Gila County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Julio Alberto Sifuentes (8/4/2023)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Julio Alberto Sifuentes (8/4/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident: 

Incident Date & Time: August 4, 2023, Officers dispatched at 4:53 PM
Location: 2915 Woodland Grove Drive, Houston, TX
Victim Name: Julio Alberto Sifuentes

I am resubmitting this request following a previous rejection from the department, noting that I had not provided sufficient information. Specifically, the department requested the date, time, location, and subject of the video. I have added the time here, along with the date, location, and subject of the video, which were listed in the original request. I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. 

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey Lamson

title: Henry Haller

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Henry Haller
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, specifically those unreleased, mentioning or describing Henry Haller (January 10, 1923 – November 7, 2020), a chef for five US presidents in the White House. His death was widely covered in the press:

https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/18/us/politics/henry-haller-dead.html

https://www.whitehousehistory.org/photos/fotoware?id=ADFEC450E3344320%209F25881E808D3C19

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: List of books removed in response to Executive Order

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: List of books removed in response to Executive Order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any document reflecting (or documents sufficient to show) the list of approximately 400 books removed from the Naval Academy library, as reported by the Associated Press: https://wjla.com/news/local/naval-academy-removes-nearly-400-books-from-library-in-new-dei-purge-ordered-by-hegseth-images-flagged-for-removal-in-purge-pentagon-military-diversity-equity-inclusion-social-media-post-removal-archive.

2. Any communications reflecting any directive, order, or command to review or remove materials from the Naval Academy library. This request is limited to communications sent or received on or after March 15, 2025.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the removal of books from a library due to their viewpoints or content.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to breaking news story of public interest. That issue has attracted media coverage, including the Associated Press report identified above. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis.

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of senior Department officials concerning their interaction with the media, implicating the Speech and Press clauses of the First Amendment.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior Department officials. Disclosing the policies and other information would demonstrate the bases for those decisions, which have attracted substantial public attention, as demonstrated by the articles and press statements cited above. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law, including its application to members of the press. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: René Verdon

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: René Verdon
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, specifically those unreleased, mentioning or describing René Verdon, a chef for former President Kennedy and his family at the White House. He was born June 29, 1924 in France; died February 2, 2011 in California.

His death was widely covered in the press;

https://www.sfgate.com/restaurants/article/Rene-Verdon-French-chef-for-JFK-White-House-dies-2477797.php

https://www.nytimes.com/2011/02/05/us/05verdon.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: AG/DOJ Letters Implementing Executive Order 14166 Application of PAFACA Act to TikTok

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Attorney General Letter Implementing Executive Order 14166 Application of PAFACA Act to TikTok
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request to the DOJ Mail Referral Unit. Please forward this request to all DOJ components likely to have responsive records. In a previous request to OAG, OIP said OAG could locate “no records.” (See FOIA-2025-02723.)

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any letters issued by the Attorney General or the Department of Justice pursuant to Section 2(c) of Executive Order 14166 of January 20, 2025, "Application of Protecting Americans From Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act to TikTok."
2. Any written guidance issued by the Attorney General or the Department of Justice pursuant to Section 2(b) of Executive Order 14166 of January 20, 2025, "Application of Protecting Americans From Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act to TikTok."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay fees for this request up to a maximum of $200. If you estimate that the fees will exceed this limit, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Please note that the requested records exist at your agency for the following reasons:

(1) Executive Order 14166 of January 20, 2025 required your agency to issue the letter that I am requesting. Specifically, Section 2 Paragraph (c) of the Executive Order required “the Attorney General to issue a letter to each provider stating that there has been no violation of the statute and that there is no liability for any conduct that occurred during the above-specified period, as well as for any conduct from the effective date of the Act until the issuance of this Executive Order.”

(2) The existence of the requested letter from your agency is widely reported in the news. Specifically:

The New York Times: “Apple and Google had recently received letters from the Justice Department assuring them that they would not face fines for carrying TikTok in their app stores, said two people with knowledge of the communications.” (https://www.nytimes.com/2025/02/13/technology/tiktok-apple-google-app-stores.html)

Bloomberg: “Apple Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google are restoring ByteDance Ltd.’s TikTok to their app stores on Thursday following assurances in a letter from US Attorney General Pam Bondi that a ban wouldn’t immediately be enforced.” (https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-02-14/apple-to-restore-tiktok-to-us-app-store-following-justice-department-letter)

Politico: “Apple restored the app after Attorney General Pam Bondi sent a letter to the company assuring it will not face fines for violating a law that banned the video-sharing platform last month, according to a person familiar with the correspondence.” (https://www.politico.com/news/2025/02/13/google-apple-restore-tiktok-00204271)

Based on the above, your agency possesses the records that I am requesting, and your agency is required to produce these records.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Tan

title: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All public records pertaining to animal cruelty investigations and any related enforcement actions conducted by the Pennsylvania Department of Agriculture, Bureau of Animal Health and Diagnostic Services, concerning the following:
    ▪︎ Anne Gibbs
    ▪︎ K9 Hero Haven, identified as #15949
    ▪︎ 176 Mahanoy Creek Lane, Herndon, PA 17830

This request encompasses, but is not limited to, all records of complaints received, inspection reports, investigative files, and any other documents generated or compiled by the Bureau in connection with said investigations. Specifically, the request seeks records covering the period from JANUARY 1, 2023, to the PRESENT DATE.

A waiver of all applicable fees associated with this request is respectfully requested. The disclosure of these records is demonstrably in the public interest, as it pertains to potential animal cruelty within an animal rescue organization. The release of this information would significantly contribute to public understanding of the oversight and operations of such organizations, thereby promoting animal welfare and fostering accountability within the community. This request is not predicated upon a commercial interest, but rather seeks to ensure the welfare of animals and promote transparency in the handling of animal cruelty complaints.

Expedited processing of this request is respectfully requested due to the potential ongoing nature of the alleged animal welfare concerns and the necessity for prompt action. Animal cruelty investigations are inherently time-sensitive, and delays in access to pertinent information may adversely affect ongoing investigations and the safety and well-being of the animals involved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Colon

title: SWAT Call Outs

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SWAT Call Outs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to SWAT call-outs:
SWAT includes SEB or any similar division at your agency
Data recorded by the department into a database or in reports that have:
- the deployment reasons/nature of each SWAT call-out (mental health, barricaded suspect, assist with federal or local partners, etc)
- any use of force, including the use of tear-gas and explosive breaching rounds
- deployment of any specialized equipment (drones, MRAPs)
- conclusion of call 
- dates
I don't need information on the who of the investigations; I need the what (use of force, specialized equipment) and why (deployment reason, conclusion of call) of each deployment. 

Please keep in native .csv if it's from a database.

Search 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P017818-040125
communications.communication: Dear Joey Scott: Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 4/1/2025 and given the reference number P017818-040125 for tracking purposes. The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/  The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.).

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P017831-040125
communications.communication:
Dear Joey Scott: Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 4/1/2025 and given the reference number P017831-040125 for tracking purposes. The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/  The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Long Beach Police Department Request Center.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: VR Police (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department's procurement or purchase of VR training equipment:
- Brochures, marketing materials including videos and demonstrations, PowerPoints from VR companies
- Invoices, Contracts, and Proposals from VR companies
- Grant requests to purchase or trial VR software and hardware
- Emails related to meetings, presentations, demonstrations, or conference appointments with VR companies. 
Search 2020 to 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott
